I waited awhile to see how transparent and attentive the devs were with the community.
Early Access is not meant to fund the game while developers go on wild spending spree's and basically tell their playerbase to ♥♥♥♥ off, which is how most early access is handled.

In it's current state Wolcen is fun for a few hours of entertainment, before you either run out of things to do or become confused with placeholders. The game is made with CryEngine and is an alpha, so expect the game to run poorly.

The game itself is fantastic, a good story, fantastic art, attention to detail.

In it's current state I would recommend buying it to support the development of the team, but not to play for very long.
It will be a month or two from this review where the game will be in a much better state based on how the team is handling things.

I eagerly backed this game the second I saw it on Kickstarter as Umbra.  They have promised Diablo meets Skyrim.

How have they done so far?

The ARPG feeling of Diablo is definitely there.  I love that.
The setting does feel more like Skyrim/TES.  It feels more medieval and serious.  I love that.
The world is absolutely gorgeous.
The music and sound are very atmosphereic.  I saw it rain, I saw weather change.  I don't see that in Diablo.
The skills seems very fun already.  The way they did lightning for example makes me feel powerful and is super fun.
The skill system is very relevant to play.
My hope is at some point we get necro/witch doctor style kills.  I love pets and pet management!
I also hope we get Monk style gameplay!

What is different so far than I had expected or hoped:
The dialog system they seem to be developing is closer to Diablo and not Skyrim.
The loot system is Diablo, not Skyrim.  This is quite disappinting.  I love the fast paced combat of Diablo, but I would prefer a more realistic loot system from Skyrim.  If there has to be a compromise, I'd prefer to loot stuff like teeth, pelt etc from wolves, ya know, stuff you would find on an animal, and then go to some mystery lottery vendor in the city and exchange all that stuff for random goodies.

The loot system being developed alone will make my forget they wanted to target anything from Skyrim.  This doesn't mean I won't play it, but it does mean they are drifting away from their vision, which is disappointing, because I want Skyrim + Diablo.

Having been on the business end of developing a huge game from alpha on, I understand system performance will be an issue for a while.  But, considering my video card (and gaming PC) is only 2 years old, it is more laggy on medium than I think it should be, even for an alpha.  I am sure this can and will be corrected,but for now, I have to I have to call it out.

Bottom line:  I like it.  I wish they would borrow more from Skyrim and make it a better balance between Skyrim and Diablo.  Love me some Diablo though.  The path they are on will be successful.

A great deal of good hack 'n slash games has been released those past few years. Diablo 3, Path of Exile, Grim Dawn and so on... And despite this, Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem may be the one with the biggest potential !

Claiming to take the best from Diablo 3 intense action, Diablo 2 athmosphere, Skyrim liberty of action and Grysis visual quality, Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem is really aiming at the top.

And though that Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem is still in a very early alpha stage, i must say that i m already very impressed.

The first time playing Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem you ll be shocked by its incredible visual quality. Lightings, FX, textures... everything is rendered in a way more impressive fashion than in any other HnS game before. The Cryengine has outdone itself !

Next you ll be surprised by how free you are to travel everywhere. There is no act I, II, III, etc with a linear path. Just go and explore the many areas of the game to discover both the game lore and places of interest. Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem has a rich story. Immerging yourself into its lore may even give you hints about secret places and treasures ! Through wandering you may find dangerous places such as dungeons taking place into caves, ancient ruins and so on. And as far as every dungeon is procedurally generated, you ll alway have new challenges exploring them.

Last but not least you ll be pleased to notice that Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem gives you a total freedom over your character build. No class restriction at all. Spend your stat points as you wish. Learn every skill or focus on a couple, this is your choice. And your choices ll have consequences... Starting with your apocalyptic form ! The apocalyptic form are mutations (wings, horns, a third arm, etc) and is a unique feature of the game making all players unique in their look and powers. While you are playing at a low level, all important actions of your character ll be recorded. Based on said data, the game ll generate specific powers for your character, called apocalyptic upgrades. So, at higher levels, every player’s apocalyptic form should differ according to their story and play style.

To conclude i can't express enough how impressed i am by Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem potential. If you re a hack 'n slash lover you can't regret investing into this game ! Especially knowing that this game price ll rise the closer we ll get from its release.

Important note : as said before Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem is currently in a very early alpha stage. So many aspects of the game are missing and others are just placeholders. Take this very ealry alpha stage of the game as a proof of concept more than anything else (especially not a final product). So be warned that if you can't stand to have a game with many bugs and missing content just don't buy the game yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Been waiting patiently for this and have not been disapinted with the result

For early access alpha it is gorgeous

Sure there are some optimising issues to be smoothed out, but that by no means diminishes how good the game is so far

Pross
- Graphics are beautifully crisp and immersive
- Freedom of movment with 360 degree rotating camera (i would like to have camera movemnt also linked to keyboard)
- Intuitive design for new skills / spells - with randomisation of which spells / skills are found making it replayable early on
- Story seems well thought and paced from the first few available quests (some re-writing of the English syntax may help for those where English is not a first language)

Cons
- Optimisation (which will be fixed in time) = game engine crashes (can sometimes lead to character loss)
- Lack of Tooltips - for me this one hopefully gets fixed soon - there's no indication of how your stat points contributte to character imrprovement, (eg Does Strength just allow for higher armour, or does it affect melee damage etc,  Does constituation affect anything other than Health pool / regen)
- Lack of tooltips on Passive Tree (what are the pre req's for learning new skills - hard to mentally plan out a build if you dont know what does or does not unlock other skills in the tree)
- There are some issues around having certain skills on your LMB in that it seems to auto-cast without clicking the button once you figure out which ones currently have issies its fine to work around)
- Qiest markers are fine - but could be smaller on mini-map
- Merchant items seem merely placeholders for now - as no real details on gear, and weapons unable to be purchased or viewed

The cons are reasonable to expect in an early alpha and will be corrected in time and as i said, by no means diminish the gameplay

It is open world, and even after completing the few early available quests, there's still plenty of world to explore, and enemies to find - although Loot is not compelling at present - some confusion over if an item is an upgrade or not (armour carrying negative weights beased on armour level it seems)

Looking forward to the twice monthly updates that have been advised to be planned

For ARPG fans I would definitely keep this on your radar - worth a look, but early access is for testing and feedback - don't expect finished product performance yet - but when it is done, it will be sbulime

Early Access Review

The game in it's current state is buggy and unoptimized (fps drops to 30s even on overclocked i7 4790k and GTX 980Ti) but devs are trying to be very active with their fixes, which is nice.

I spent over 2k hours in Diablo 3 and really waited for Wolcen. It's still to early to think about content in this game, but the most important thing in Diablo-style RPGs for me is fun from killing monsters and decent end-game content.

What I liked:
- Having fun killing mobs. It is a very important thing for aRPGs
- Beautiful graphics, spells effects
- Even tho the loading screen states that sound design is not yet finished, I really enjoyed the sound in the game even at this stage

Disliked:
- Don't really like the UI. HP and MP spheres are placed in the corners of the screen. It's too wide on 16:9 screen and you have to move your eyes to opposite corners of the screens (might be even more painful on 21:9 if the game supports them). I would like them to be closer to the center. Also dialogue boxes aren't cute in my opinion, and the text fonts don't match the game, sometimes the text goes out of the corners. I would completely reword most of UI parts tbh.
- Builds balance is weird at the moment. I learned electrical spell (don't remember the name) and put it to right mouse button. It didn't have cd (just small manacost) and I could spam it to oneshot most of the mobs. Other spells weren't even close to the power of this spell.
- Performance. As stated above there are some issues, but the fixes are coming soon.

Also take in mind that the game does not offer a big amount of content right now and I wasn't even able to test the whole available content due to bugs, performance and crashes issues.

I believe that the devs can make this game much better, they just need time and more budget. If you like these kind of games I recommend you to buy this game to support developers and help them by reporting bugs. They seem to be active and they listen to players feedback which is a rare thing nowadays. If you expect to play finished game right now you would be disappointed. Don't be lazy, just buy a game and try to help to improve it together.
